H0.text: What country dominated the East Indies spice trade in the 17th and 18th centuries. Portugal

H1.text: What country dominated the East Indies spice trade in the 17th and 18th centuries. England

H2.text: What country dominated the East Indies spice trade in the 17th and 18th centuries. France

H3.text: What country dominated the East Indies spice trade in the 17th and 18th centuries. Olanda

A4.text: The Dutch East India Company was established in 1602 with the authority to wage war and build fortresses across Asia.

A5.text: The first Dutch expedition to access spices directly from Asia set sail in 1595, leading to the formation of the Dutch East India Company.
